meanings.definition: To exchange or trade something with someone else.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we swapped our lunch boxes at school.
meanings.sent2: They swapped their toys to play with something new.
meanings.sent3: The siblings swapped their chores, causing chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players can swap their cards to strategize better.
meanings.sent5: The friends swapped stories around the campfire, creating lasting memories.

meanings.sent1: Last week, she swapped her old phone for a new one.
meanings.sent2: He swapped his baseball cards with his friend last summer.
meanings.sent3: The magician swapped hats with a rabbit, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The seasons swapped places overnight, bringing unexpected weather.
meanings.sent5: The characters in the story swapped identities, leading to hilarious misunderstandings.
